-- | Information about the knowledge base.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKnowledgeBaseData</a> smart constructor.
data KnowledgeBaseData
KnowledgeBaseData' :: Maybe RenderingConfiguration -> Maybe SourceConfiguration -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseData

-- | Information about how to render the content.
[$sel:renderingConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Maybe RenderingConfiguration

-- | Source configuration information about the knowledge base.
[$sel:sourceConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Maybe SourceConfiguration

-- | An epoch timestamp indicating the most recent content modification
--   inside the knowledge base. If no content exists in a knowledge base,
--   this value is unset.
[$sel:lastContentModificationTime:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The description.
[$sel:description:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key used for encryption.
[$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Text

-- | The type of knowledge base.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseType:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> KnowledgeBaseType

-- | The name of the knowledge base.
[$sel:name:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> Text

-- | The status of the knowledge base.
[$sel:status:KnowledgeBaseData'] :: KnowledgeBaseData -> KnowledgeBaseStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>KnowledgeBaseData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:renderingConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_renderingConfiguration</a> - Information about
--   how to render the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_sourceConfiguration</a> - Source configuration
--   information about the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastContentModificationTime:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_lastContentModificationTime</a> - An epoch
--   timestamp indicating the most recent content modification inside the
--   knowledge base. If no content exists in a knowledge base, this value
--   is unset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_description</a> - The description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The KMS
--   key used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>, <a>knowledgeBaseData_tags</a> -
--   The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseType:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseType</a> - The type of knowledge
--   base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>, <a>knowledgeBaseData_name</a> -
--   The name of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>, <a>knowledgeBaseData_status</a>
--   - The status of the knowledge base.
newKnowledgeBaseData :: Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseData

-- | Information about how to render the content.
knowledgeBaseData_renderingConfiguration :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData (Maybe RenderingConfiguration)

-- | Source configuration information about the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseData_sourceConfiguration :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData (Maybe SourceConfiguration)

-- | An epoch timestamp indicating the most recent content modification
--   inside the knowledge base. If no content exists in a knowledge base,
--   this value is unset.
knowledgeBaseData_lastContentModificationTime :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The description.
knowledgeBaseData_description :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData (Maybe Text)

-- | The KMS key used for encryption.
knowledgeBaseData_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData (Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration)

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
knowledgeBaseData_tags :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseArn :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData Text

-- | The type of knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseType :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData KnowledgeBaseType

-- | The name of the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseData_name :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData Text

-- | The status of the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseData_status :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseData KnowledgeBaseStatus

-- | Summary information about the knowledge base.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKnowledgeBaseSummary</a> smart constructor.
data KnowledgeBaseSummary
KnowledgeBaseSummary' :: Maybe RenderingConfiguration -> Maybe SourceConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseSummary

-- | Information about how to render the content.
[$sel:renderingConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Maybe RenderingConfiguration

-- | <ul>
--   <li><i>KEVIN</i></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sourceConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Maybe SourceConfiguration

-- | The description of the knowledge base.
[$sel:description:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key used for encryption.
[$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Text

-- | The type of knowledge base.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseType:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> KnowledgeBaseType

-- | The name of the knowledge base.
[$sel:name:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> Text

-- | The status of the knowledge base summary.
[$sel:status:KnowledgeBaseSummary'] :: KnowledgeBaseSummary -> KnowledgeBaseStatus

-- | Create a value of <a>KnowledgeBaseSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:renderingConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_renderingConfiguration</a> - Information about
--   how to render the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_sourceConfiguration</a> - [KEVIN]
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_description</a> - The description of the
--   knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The
--   KMS key used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_tags</a> - The tags used to organize, track,
--   or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of
--   the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseType:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseType</a> - The type of knowledge
--   base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_name</a> - The name of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_status</a> - The status of the knowledge base
--   summary.
newKnowledgeBaseSummary :: Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseSummary

knowledgeBaseSummary_renderingConfiguration :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary (Maybe RenderingConfiguration)

--   <li><i>KEVIN</i></li>
--   </ul>
knowledgeBaseSummary_sourceConfiguration :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary (Maybe SourceConfiguration)

knowledgeBaseSummary_description :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The KMS key used for encryption.
knowledgeBaseSummary_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary (Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration)

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
knowledgeBaseSummary_tags :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseArn :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary Text

-- | The type of knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseType :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary KnowledgeBaseType

-- | The name of the knowledge base.
knowledgeBaseSummary_name :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary Text

-- | The status of the knowledge base summary.
knowledgeBaseSummary_status :: Lens' KnowledgeBaseSummary KnowledgeBaseStatus

-- | An error occurred when creating a recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotifyRecommendationsReceivedError</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError
NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError

-- | The identifier of the recommendation that is in error.
[$sel:recommendationId:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError -> Maybe Text

-- | A recommendation is causing an error.
[$sel:message:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationId:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceivedError_recommendationId</a> - The
--   identifier of the recommendation that is in error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceivedError_message</a> - A recommendation
--   is causing an error.
newNotifyRecommendationsReceivedError :: NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError

-- | The identifier of the recommendation that is in error.
notifyRecommendationsReceivedError_recommendationId :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError (Maybe Text)

-- | A recommendation is causing an error.
notifyRecommendationsReceivedError_message :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationData</a> smart constructor.
data RecommendationData
RecommendationData' :: Maybe RelevanceLevel -> Maybe Double -> Document -> Text -> RecommendationData

-- | The relevance level of the recommendation.
[$sel:relevanceLevel:RecommendationData'] :: RecommendationData -> Maybe RelevanceLevel

-- | The relevance score of the recommendation.
[$sel:relevanceScore:RecommendationData'] :: RecommendationData -> Maybe Double

-- | The recommended document.
[$sel:document:RecommendationData'] :: RecommendationData -> Document

-- | The identifier of the recommendation.
[$sel:recommendationId:RecommendationData'] :: RecommendationData -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relevanceLevel:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_relevanceLevel</a> - The relevance level of the
--   recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relevanceScore:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_relevanceScore</a> - The relevance score of the
--   recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:document:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_document</a> - The recommended document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationId:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_recommendationId</a> - The identifier of the
--   recommendation.
newRecommendationData :: Document -> Text -> RecommendationData

-- | The relevance level of the recommendation.
recommendationData_relevanceLevel :: Lens' RecommendationData (Maybe RelevanceLevel)

-- | The relevance score of the recommendation.
recommendationData_relevanceScore :: Lens' RecommendationData (Maybe Double)

-- | The recommended document.
recommendationData_document :: Lens' RecommendationData Document

-- | The identifier of the recommendation.
recommendationData_recommendationId :: Lens' RecommendationData Text

-- | Information about how to render the content.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRenderingConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data RenderingConfiguration
RenderingConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> RenderingConfiguration

-- | A URI template containing exactly one variable in <tt>${variableName}
--   </tt>format. This can only be set for <tt>EXTERNAL</tt> knowledge
--   bases. For Salesforce and ServiceNow, the variable must be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Salesforce: <tt>Id</tt>, <tt>ArticleNumber</tt>,
--   <tt>VersionNumber</tt>, <tt>Title</tt>, <tt>PublishStatus</tt>, or
--   <tt>IsDeleted</tt></li>
--   <li>ServiceNow: <tt>number</tt>, <tt>short_description</tt>,
--   <tt>sys_mod_count</tt>, <tt>workflow_state</tt>, or
--   <tt>active</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;p&gt;The variable is replaced with the actual value for a piece of content when calling &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wisdom/latest/APIReference/API_GetContent.html"&gt;GetContent&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;/p&gt;
--   </pre>
[$sel:templateUri:RenderingConfiguration'] :: RenderingConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RenderingConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateUri:RenderingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>renderingConfiguration_templateUri</a> - A URI template containing
--   exactly one variable in <tt>${variableName} </tt>format. This can only
--   be set for <tt>EXTERNAL</tt> knowledge bases. For Salesforce and
--   ServiceNow, the variable must be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Salesforce: <tt>Id</tt>, <tt>ArticleNumber</tt>,
--   <tt>VersionNumber</tt>, <tt>Title</tt>, <tt>PublishStatus</tt>, or
--   <tt>IsDeleted</tt></li>
--   <li>ServiceNow: <tt>number</tt>, <tt>short_description</tt>,
--   <tt>sys_mod_count</tt>, <tt>workflow_state</tt>, or
--   <tt>active</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;p&gt;The variable is replaced with the actual value for a piece of content when calling &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wisdom/latest/APIReference/API_GetContent.html"&gt;GetContent&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;/p&gt;
--   </pre>
newRenderingConfiguration :: RenderingConfiguration

-- | A URI template containing exactly one variable in <tt>${variableName}
--   </tt>format. This can only be set for <tt>EXTERNAL</tt> knowledge
--   bases. For Salesforce and ServiceNow, the variable must be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Salesforce: <tt>Id</tt>, <tt>ArticleNumber</tt>,
--   <tt>VersionNumber</tt>, <tt>Title</tt>, <tt>PublishStatus</tt>, or
--   <tt>IsDeleted</tt></li>
--   <li>ServiceNow: <tt>number</tt>, <tt>short_description</tt>,
--   <tt>sys_mod_count</tt>, <tt>workflow_state</tt>, or
--   <tt>active</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;p&gt;The variable is replaced with the actual value for a piece of content when calling &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wisdom/latest/APIReference/API_GetContent.html"&gt;GetContent&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;/p&gt;
--   </pre>
renderingConfiguration_templateUri :: Lens' RenderingConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the result.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultData</a> smart constructor.
data ResultData
ResultData' :: Maybe Double -> Document -> Text -> ResultData

-- | The relevance score of the results.
[$sel:relevanceScore:ResultData'] :: ResultData -> Maybe Double

-- | The document.
[$sel:document:ResultData'] :: ResultData -> Document

-- | The identifier of the result data.
[$sel:resultId:ResultData'] :: ResultData -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ResultData</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relevanceScore:ResultData'</a>,
--   <a>resultData_relevanceScore</a> - The relevance score of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:document:ResultData'</a>, <a>resultData_document</a> - The
--   document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultId:ResultData'</a>, <a>resultData_resultId</a> - The
--   identifier of the result data.
newResultData :: Document -> Text -> ResultData

-- | The relevance score of the results.
resultData_relevanceScore :: Lens' ResultData (Maybe Double)

-- | The document.
resultData_document :: Lens' ResultData Document

-- | The identifier of the result data.
resultData_resultId :: Lens' ResultData Text

-- | The search expression.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchExpression</a> smart constructor.

[$sel:filters:SearchExpression'] :: SearchExpression -> [Filter]

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchExpression</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:filters:SearchExpression'</a>, <a>searchExpression_filters</a>
--   - The search expression filters.
newSearchExpression :: SearchExpression

-- | The search expression filters.
searchExpression_filters :: Lens' SearchExpression [Filter]

-- | The KMS key used for encryption.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServerSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration

--   identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>AWS Key Management Service Developer
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:kmsKeyId:ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration'] :: ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   information about valid ID values, see <a>Key identifiers (KeyId)</a>
--   in the <i>AWS Key Management Service Developer Guide</i>.

--   identifiers (KeyId)</a> in the <i>AWS Key Management Service Developer
--   Guide</i>.
serverSideEncryptionConfiguration_kmsKeyId :: Lens' ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the session.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionData</a> smart constructor.
data SessionData
SessionData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SessionData

-- | The description of the session.
[$sel:description:SessionData'] :: SessionData -> Maybe Text

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:SessionData'] :: SessionData -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the session.
[$sel:name:SessionData'] :: SessionData -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session.
[$sel:sessionArn:SessionData'] :: SessionData -> Text

-- | The identifier of the session.
[$sel:sessionId:SessionData'] :: SessionData -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SessionData</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_description</a> -
--   The description of the session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_tags</a> - The tags used
--   to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_name</a> - The name of
--   the session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionArn:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_sessionArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionId:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_sessionId</a> - The
--   identifier of the session.
newSessionData :: Text -> Text -> Text -> SessionData

-- | The description of the session.
sessionData_description :: Lens' SessionData (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
sessionData_tags :: Lens' SessionData (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the session.
sessionData_name :: Lens' SessionData Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session.
sessionData_sessionArn :: Lens' SessionData Text

-- | The identifier of the session.
sessionData_sessionId :: Lens' SessionData Text

-- | Summary information about the session.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data SessionSummary
SessionSummary' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SessionSummary

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Wisdom assistant
[$sel:assistantArn:SessionSummary'] :: SessionSummary -> Text

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant.
[$sel:assistantId:SessionSummary'] :: SessionSummary -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session.
[$sel:sessionArn:SessionSummary'] :: SessionSummary -> Text

-- | The identifier of the session.

--   assistant.

--   the session.

newSessionSummary :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SessionSummary

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant.
sessionSummary_assistantId :: Lens' SessionSummary Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session.
sessionSummary_sessionArn :: Lens' SessionSummary Text

-- | The identifier of the session.
sessionSummary_sessionId :: Lens' SessionSummary Text

--   ingest content.

-- | Adds the specified tags to the specified resource.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   to organize, track, or control access for this resource.

-- | Get a URL to upload content to a knowledge base. To upload content,
--   first make a PUT request to the returned URL with your file, making
--   sure to include the required headers. Then use <a>CreateContent</a> to
--   finalize the content creation process or <a>UpdateContent</a> to
--   modify an existing resource. You can only upload content to a
--   knowledge base of type CUSTOM.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartContentUpload</a> smart constructor.
data StartContentUpload
StartContentUpload' :: Text -> Text -> StartContentUpload

-- | The type of content to upload.
[$sel:contentType:StartContentUpload'] :: StartContentUpload -> Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:StartContentUpload'] :: StartContentUpload -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>StartContentUpload</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:StartContentUpload'</a>,
--   <a>startContentUpload_contentType</a> - The type of content to upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:StartContentUpload'</a>,
--   <a>startContentUpload_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.
newStartContentUpload :: Text -> Text -> StartContentUpload

-- | The type of content to upload.
startContentUpload_contentType :: Lens' StartContentUpload Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
startContentUpload_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' StartContentUpload Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newStartContentUploadResponse</a> smart constructor.
data StartContentUploadResponse
StartContentUploadResponse' :: Int -> HashMap Text Text -> Text -> Sensitive Text -> POSIX -> StartContentUploadResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:StartContentUploadResponse'] :: StartContentUploadResponse -> Int

-- | The headers to include in the upload.
[$sel:headersToInclude:StartContentUploadResponse'] :: StartContentUploadResponse -> HashMap Text Text

-- | The identifier of the upload.
[$sel:uploadId:StartContentUploadResponse'] :: StartContentUploadResponse -> Text

-- | The URL of the upload.
[$sel:url:StartContentUploadResponse'] :: StartContentUploadResponse -> Sensitive Text

-- | The expiration time of the URL as an epoch timestamp.
[$sel:urlExpiry:StartContentUploadResponse'] :: StartContentUploadResponse -> POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>StartContentUploadResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:StartContentUploadResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startContentUploadResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:headersToInclude:StartContentUploadResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startContentUploadResponse_headersToInclude</a> - The headers to
--   include in the upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:StartContentUploadResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startContentUploadResponse_uploadId</a> - The identifier of the
--   upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:StartContentUploadResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startContentUploadResponse_url</a> - The URL of the upload.
--   
--   <a>$sel:urlExpiry:StartContentUploadResponse'</a>,
--   <a>startContentUploadResponse_urlExpiry</a> - The expiration time of
--   the URL as an epoch timestamp.
newStartContentUploadResponse :: Int -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> StartContentUploadResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
startContentUploadResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' StartContentUploadResponse Int

-- | The headers to include in the upload.
startContentUploadResponse_headersToInclude :: Lens' StartContentUploadResponse (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The identifier of the upload.
startContentUploadResponse_uploadId :: Lens' StartContentUploadResponse Text

-- | The URL of the upload.
startContentUploadResponse_url :: Lens' StartContentUploadResponse Text

-- | The expiration time of the URL as an epoch timestamp.
startContentUploadResponse_urlExpiry :: Lens' StartContentUploadResponse UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload.StartContentUpload
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload.StartContentUpload
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload.StartContentUpload
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload.StartContentUpload
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload.StartContentUploadResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload.StartContentUploadResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.StartContentUpload.StartContentUploadResponse

-- | Searches for sessions.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchSessions

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchSessions</a> smart constructor.
data SearchSessions
SearchSessions' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> SearchExpression -> SearchSessions

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchSessions'] :: SearchSessions -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:SearchSessions'] :: SearchSessions -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantId:SearchSessions'] :: SearchSessions -> Text

-- | The search expression to filter results.
[$sel:searchExpression:SearchSessions'] :: SearchSessions -> SearchExpression

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchSessions</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SearchSessions'</a>, <a>searchSessions_nextToken</a>
--   - The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:SearchSessions'</a>,
--   <a>searchSessions_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:SearchSessions'</a>,
--   <a>searchSessions_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the Wisdom
--   assistant. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:searchExpression:SearchSessions'</a>,
--   <a>searchSessions_searchExpression</a> - The search expression to
--   filter results.
newSearchSessions :: Text -> SearchExpression -> SearchSessions

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
searchSessions_nextToken :: Lens' SearchSessions (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
searchSessions_maxResults :: Lens' SearchSessions (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
searchSessions_assistantId :: Lens' SearchSessions Text

-- | The search expression to filter results.
searchSessions_searchExpression :: Lens' SearchSessions SearchExpression

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchSessionsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SearchSessionsResponse
SearchSessionsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [SessionSummary] -> SearchSessionsResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchSessionsResponse'] :: SearchSessionsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SearchSessionsResponse'] :: SearchSessionsResponse -> Int

-- | Summary information about the sessions.
[$sel:sessionSummaries:SearchSessionsResponse'] :: SearchSessionsResponse -> [SessionSummary]

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchSessionsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SearchSessions'</a>,
--   <a>searchSessionsResponse_nextToken</a> - If there are additional
--   results, this is the token for the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SearchSessionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchSessionsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionSummaries:SearchSessionsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchSessionsResponse_sessionSummaries</a> - Summary information
--   about the sessions.
newSearchSessionsResponse :: Int -> SearchSessionsResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
searchSessionsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' SearchSessionsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
searchSessionsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SearchSessionsResponse Int

-- | Summary information about the sessions.
searchSessionsResponse_sessionSummaries :: Lens' SearchSessionsResponse [SessionSummary]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchSessions.SearchSessions
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchSessions.SearchSessions
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchSessions.SearchSessions
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchSessions.SearchSessions
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchSessions.SearchSessionsResponse

instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchSessions.SearchSessions

-- | Searches for content in a specified knowledge base. Can be used to get
--   a specific content resource by its name.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.SearchContent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchContent</a> smart constructor.
data SearchContent
SearchContent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> SearchExpression -> SearchContent

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchContent'] :: SearchContent -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:SearchContent'] :: SearchContent -> Maybe Natural

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:SearchContent'] :: SearchContent -> Text

-- | The search expression to filter results.
[$sel:searchExpression:SearchContent'] :: SearchContent -> SearchExpression

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SearchContent'</a>, <a>searchContent_nextToken</a> -
--   The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:SearchContent'</a>, <a>searchContent_maxResults</a>
--   - The maximum number of results to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:SearchContent'</a>,
--   <a>searchContent_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:searchExpression:SearchContent'</a>,
--   <a>searchContent_searchExpression</a> - The search expression to
--   filter results.
newSearchContent :: Text -> SearchExpression -> SearchContent

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
searchContent_nextToken :: Lens' SearchContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
searchContent_maxResults :: Lens' SearchContent (Maybe Natural)

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
searchContent_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' SearchContent Text

-- | The search expression to filter results.
searchContent_searchExpression :: Lens' SearchContent SearchExpression

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newSearchContentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SearchContentResponse
SearchContentResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [ContentSummary] -> SearchContentResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:SearchContentResponse'] :: SearchContentResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:SearchContentResponse'] :: SearchContentResponse -> Int

-- | Summary information about the content.
[$sel:contentSummaries:SearchContentResponse'] :: SearchContentResponse -> [ContentSummary]

-- | Create a value of <a>SearchContentResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:SearchContent'</a>,
--   <a>searchContentResponse_nextToken</a> - If there are additional
--   results, this is the token for the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:SearchContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchContentResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentSummaries:SearchContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>searchContentResponse_contentSummaries</a> - Summary information
--   about the content.
newSearchContentResponse :: Int -> SearchContentResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
searchContentResponse_nextToken :: Lens' SearchContentResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
searchContentResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' SearchContentResponse Int

-- | Summary information about the content.
searchContentResponse_contentSummaries :: Lens' SearchContentResponse [ContentSummary]

-- | Performs a manual search against the specified assistant. To retrieve
--   recommendations for an assistant, use <a>GetRecommendations</a>.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newQueryAssistant</a> smart constructor.
data QueryAssistant
QueryAssistant' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> Sensitive Text -> QueryAssistant

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:QueryAssistant'] :: QueryAssistant -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:QueryAssistant'] :: QueryAssistant -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantId:QueryAssistant'] :: QueryAssistant -> Text

-- | The text to search for.
[$sel:queryText:QueryAssistant'] :: QueryAssistant -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>QueryAssistant</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:QueryAssistant'</a>, <a>queryAssistant_nextToken</a>
--   - The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:QueryAssistant'</a>,
--   <a>queryAssistant_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:QueryAssistant'</a>,
--   <a>queryAssistant_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the Wisdom
--   assistant. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:queryText:QueryAssistant'</a>, <a>queryAssistant_queryText</a>
--   - The text to search for.
newQueryAssistant :: Text -> Text -> QueryAssistant

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
queryAssistant_nextToken :: Lens' QueryAssistant (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
queryAssistant_maxResults :: Lens' QueryAssistant (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
queryAssistant_assistantId :: Lens' QueryAssistant Text

-- | The text to search for.
queryAssistant_queryText :: Lens' QueryAssistant Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newQueryAssistantResponse</a> smart constructor.
data QueryAssistantResponse
QueryAssistantResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [ResultData] -> QueryAssistantResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:QueryAssistantResponse'] :: QueryAssistantResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:QueryAssistantResponse'] :: QueryAssistantResponse -> Int

-- | The results of the query.
[$sel:results:QueryAssistantResponse'] :: QueryAssistantResponse -> [ResultData]

-- | Create a value of <a>QueryAssistantResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:QueryAssistant'</a>,
--   <a>queryAssistantResponse_nextToken</a> - If there are additional
--   results, this is the token for the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:QueryAssistantResponse'</a>,
--   <a>queryAssistantResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:results:QueryAssistantResponse'</a>,
--   <a>queryAssistantResponse_results</a> - The results of the query.
newQueryAssistantResponse :: Int -> QueryAssistantResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
queryAssistantResponse_nextToken :: Lens' QueryAssistantResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
queryAssistantResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' QueryAssistantResponse Int

-- | The results of the query.
queryAssistantResponse_results :: Lens' QueryAssistantResponse [ResultData]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistantResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistantResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistantResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistantResponse
instance Amazonka.Pager.AWSPager Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant

instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant

instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Wisdom.QueryAssistant.QueryAssistant


-- | Removes the specified recommendations from the specified assistant's
--   queue of newly available recommendations. You can use this API in
--   conjunction with <a>GetRecommendations</a> and a
--   <tt>waitTimeSeconds</tt> input for long-polling behavior and avoiding
--   duplicate recommendations.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.NotifyRecommendationsReceived

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newNotifyRecommendationsReceived</a> smart constructor.
data NotifyRecommendationsReceived
NotifyRecommendationsReceived' :: Text -> [Text] -> Text -> NotifyRecommendationsReceived

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantId:NotifyRecommendationsReceived'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceived -> Text

-- | The identifiers of the recommendations.
[$sel:recommendationIds:NotifyRecommendationsReceived'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceived -> [Text]

-- | The identifier of the session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:sessionId:NotifyRecommendationsReceived'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceived -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>NotifyRecommendationsReceived</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:NotifyRecommendationsReceived'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceived_assistantId</a> - The identifier of
--   the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot
--   contain the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationIds:NotifyRecommendationsReceived'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceived_recommendationIds</a> - The
--   identifiers of the recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionId:NotifyRecommendationsReceived'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceived_sessionId</a> - The identifier of the
--   session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
newNotifyRecommendationsReceived :: Text -> Text -> NotifyRecommendationsReceived

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
notifyRecommendationsReceived_assistantId :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceived Text

-- | The identifiers of the recommendations.
notifyRecommendationsReceived_recommendationIds :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceived [Text]

-- | The identifier of the session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
notifyRecommendationsReceived_sessionId :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceived Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newNotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse
NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError] -> Int -> NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse

-- | The identifiers of the recommendations.
[$sel:recommendationIds:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The identifiers of recommendations that are causing errors.
[$sel:errors:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse -> Maybe [NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse'] :: NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationIds:NotifyRecommendationsReceived'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse_recommendationIds</a> - The
--   identifiers of the recommendations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:errors:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse_errors</a> - The identifiers
--   of recommendations that are causing errors.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newNotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse :: Int -> NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse

-- | The identifiers of the recommendations.
notifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse_recommendationIds :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | The identifiers of recommendations that are causing errors.
notifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse_errors :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse (Maybe [NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError])

-- | The response's http status code.
notifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' NotifyRecommendationsReceivedResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.NotifyRecommendationsReceived.NotifyRecommendationsReceived
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.NotifyRecommendationsReceived.NotifyRecommendationsReceived
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.NotifyRecommendationsReceived.NotifyRecommendationsReceived

-- | Lists the knowledge bases.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListKnowledgeBases</a> smart constructor.
data ListKnowledgeBases
ListKnowledgeBases' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ListKnowledgeBases

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListKnowledgeBases'] :: ListKnowledgeBases -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:ListKnowledgeBases'] :: ListKnowledgeBases -> Maybe Natural

-- | Create a value of <a>ListKnowledgeBases</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>listKnowledgeBases_nextToken</a> - The token for the next set of
--   results. Use the value returned in the previous response in the next
--   request to retrieve the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListKnowledgeBases'</a>,
--   <a>listKnowledgeBases_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return per page.
newListKnowledgeBases :: ListKnowledgeBases

--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
listKnowledgeBases_maxResults :: Lens' ListKnowledgeBases (Maybe Natural)

--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListKnowledgeBasesResponse'] :: ListKnowledgeBasesResponse -> Maybe Text

[$sel:httpStatus:ListKnowledgeBasesResponse'] :: ListKnowledgeBasesResponse -> Int

[$sel:knowledgeBaseSummaries:ListKnowledgeBasesResponse'] :: ListKnowledgeBasesResponse -> [KnowledgeBaseSummary]

--   fields omitted.

--   results, this is the token for the next set of results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListKnowledgeBasesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listKnowledgeBasesResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseSummaries:ListKnowledgeBasesResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listKnowledgeBasesResponse_knowledgeBaseSummaries</a> - Information
--   about the knowledge bases.

--   results.

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases.ListKnowledgeBasesResponse
instance Amazonka.Pager.AWSPager Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases.ListKnowledgeBases
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases.ListKnowledgeBases
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases.ListKnowledgeBases
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases.ListKnowledgeBases
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases.ListKnowledgeBases
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Wisdom.ListKnowledgeBases.ListKnowledgeBases


-- | Lists the content.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.ListContents

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContents</a> smart constructor.
data ListContents
ListContents' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> ListContents

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListContents'] :: ListContents -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:ListContents'] :: ListContents -> Maybe Natural

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:ListContents'] :: ListContents -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ListContents</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListContents'</a>, <a>listContents_nextToken</a> -
--   The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListContents'</a>, <a>listContents_maxResults</a> -
--   The maximum number of results to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:ListContents'</a>,
--   <a>listContents_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.
newListContents :: Text -> ListContents

-- | The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
listContents_nextToken :: Lens' ListContents (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
listContents_maxResults :: Lens' ListContents (Maybe Natural)

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
listContents_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' ListContents Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newListContentsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ListContentsResponse
ListContentsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Int -> [ContentSummary] -> ListContentsResponse

-- | If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of
--   results.
[$sel:nextToken:ListContentsResponse'] :: ListContentsResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:ListContentsResponse'] :: ListContentsResponse -> Int

-- | Information about the content.
[$sel:contentSummaries:ListContentsResponse'] :: ListContentsResponse -> [ContentSummary]

--   omitted.
--

--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:ListContentsResponse'</a>,

--   code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentSummaries:ListContentsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>listContentsResponse_contentSummaries</a> - Information about the
--   content.

--   results.

-- | Retrieves information for a specified session.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.GetSession

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSession</a> smart constructor.
data GetSession
GetSession' :: Text -> Text -> GetSession

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantId:GetSession'] :: GetSession -> Text

-- | The identifier of the session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:sessionId:GetSession'] :: GetSession -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetSession</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:GetSession'</a>, <a>getSession_assistantId</a> -
--   The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionId:GetSession'</a>, <a>getSession_sessionId</a> - The
--   identifier of the session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
newGetSession :: Text -> Text -> GetSession

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
getSession_assistantId :: Lens' GetSession Text

-- | The identifier of the session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
getSession_sessionId :: Lens' GetSession Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetSessionResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetSessionResponse
GetSessionResponse' :: Maybe SessionData -> Int -> GetSessionResponse

-- | The session.
[$sel:session:GetSessionResponse'] :: GetSessionResponse -> Maybe SessionData

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetSessionResponse'] :: GetSessionResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetSessionResponse</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:session:GetSessionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getSessionResponse_session</a> - The session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetSessionResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getSessionResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetSessionResponse :: Int -> GetSessionResponse

-- | The session.
getSessionResponse_session :: Lens' GetSessionResponse (Maybe SessionData)

-- | The response's http status code.
getSessionResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetSessionResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.GetSession.GetSession

instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.GetSession.GetSessionResponse

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Wisdom.GetSession.GetSession
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.GetSession.GetSession

instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Wisdom.GetSession.GetSession
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Wisdom.GetSession.GetSession


-- | Retrieves recommendations for the specified session. To avoid
--   retrieving the same recommendations in subsequent calls, use
--   <a>NotifyRecommendationsReceived</a>. This API supports long-polling
--   behavior with the <tt>waitTimeSeconds</tt> parameter. Short poll is
--   the default behavior and only returns recommendations already
--   available. To perform a manual query against an assistant, use
--   <a>QueryAssistant</a>.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRecommendations</a> smart constructor.
data GetRecommendations
GetRecommendations' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Text -> Text -> GetRecommendations

-- | The duration (in seconds) for which the call waits for a
--   recommendation to be made available before returning. If a
--   recommendation is available, the call returns sooner than
--   <tt>WaitTimeSeconds</tt>. If no messages are available and the wait
--   time expires, the call returns successfully with an empty list.
[$sel:waitTimeSeconds:GetRecommendations'] :: GetRecommendations -> Maybe Natural

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
[$sel:maxResults:GetRecommendations'] :: GetRecommendations -> Maybe Natural

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantId:GetRecommendations'] :: GetRecommendations -> Text

-- | The identifier of the session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:sessionId:GetRecommendations'] :: GetRecommendations -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRecommendations</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:waitTimeSeconds:GetRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendations_waitTimeSeconds</a> - The duration (in seconds)
--   for which the call waits for a recommendation to be made available
--   before returning. If a recommendation is available, the call returns
--   sooner than <tt>WaitTimeSeconds</tt>. If no messages are available and
--   the wait time expires, the call returns successfully with an empty
--   list.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendations_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results
--   to return per page.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:GetRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendations_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the Wisdom
--   assistant. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionId:GetRecommendations'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendations_sessionId</a> - The identifier of the session.
--   Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
newGetRecommendations :: Text -> Text -> GetRecommendations

-- | The duration (in seconds) for which the call waits for a
--   recommendation to be made available before returning. If a
--   recommendation is available, the call returns sooner than
--   <tt>WaitTimeSeconds</tt>. If no messages are available and the wait
--   time expires, the call returns successfully with an empty list.
getRecommendations_waitTimeSeconds :: Lens' GetRecommendations (Maybe Natural)

-- | The maximum number of results to return per page.
getRecommendations_maxResults :: Lens' GetRecommendations (Maybe Natural)

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
getRecommendations_assistantId :: Lens' GetRecommendations Text

-- | The identifier of the session. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
getRecommendations_sessionId :: Lens' GetRecommendations Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRecommendationsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetRecommendationsResponse
GetRecommendationsResponse' :: Int -> [RecommendationData] -> GetRecommendationsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetRecommendationsResponse'] :: GetRecommendationsResponse -> Int

-- | The recommendations.
[$sel:recommendations:GetRecommendationsResponse'] :: GetRecommendationsResponse -> [RecommendationData]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRecommendationsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetRecommendationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendationsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendations:GetRecommendationsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getRecommendationsResponse_recommendations</a> - The
--   recommendations.
newGetRecommendationsResponse :: Int -> GetRecommendationsResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
getRecommendationsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetRecommendationsResponse Int

-- | The recommendations.
getRecommendationsResponse_recommendations :: Lens' GetRecommendationsResponse [RecommendationData]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendationsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendationsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendationsResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendationsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Wisdom.GetRecommendations.GetRecommendations


-- | Retrieves information about the knowledge base.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.GetKnowledgeBase

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetKnowledgeBase</a> smart constructor.
data GetKnowledgeBase
GetKnowledgeBase' :: Text -> GetKnowledgeBase

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:GetKnowledgeBase'] :: GetKnowledgeBase -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetKnowledgeBase</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
getKnowledgeBase_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' GetKnowledgeBase Text

-- | Retrieves content, including a pre-signed URL to download the content.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.GetContent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetContent</a> smart constructor.
data GetContent
GetContent' :: Text -> Text -> GetContent

-- | The identifier of the content. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:contentId:GetContent'] :: GetContent -> Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:GetContent'] :: GetContent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetContent</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentId:GetContent'</a>, <a>getContent_contentId</a> - The
--   identifier of the content. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:GetContent'</a>,
--   <a>getContent_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.

-- | The identifier of the content. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
getContent_contentId :: Lens' GetContent Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
getContent_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' GetContent Text

-- | Deletes the knowledge base.
--   
--   When you use this API to delete an external knowledge base such as
--   Salesforce or ServiceNow, you must also delete the <a>Amazon
--   AppIntegrations</a> DataIntegration. This is because you can't reuse
--   the DataIntegration after it's been associated with an external
--   knowledge base. However, you can delete and recreate it. See
--   <a>DeleteDataIntegration</a> and <a>CreateDataIntegration</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon AppIntegrations API Reference</i>.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteKnowledgeBase</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteKnowledgeBase
DeleteKnowledgeBase' :: Text -> DeleteKnowledgeBase

-- | The knowledge base to delete content from. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:DeleteKnowledgeBase'] :: DeleteKnowledgeBase -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteKnowledgeBase</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:DeleteKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>deleteKnowledgeBase_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The knowledge base to
--   delete content from. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot
--   contain the ARN.
newDeleteKnowledgeBase :: Text -> DeleteKnowledgeBase

-- | The knowledge base to delete content from. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
deleteKnowledgeBase_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' DeleteKnowledgeBase Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse
DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse' :: Int -> DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse'] :: DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteKnowledgeBaseResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse :: Int -> DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse

-- | The response's http status code.
deleteKnowledgeBaseResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBaseResponse

instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteKnowledgeBase.DeleteKnowledgeBase

--   cannot contain the ARN.

--   cannot contain the ARN.

--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.

-- | Deletes an assistant association.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.DeleteAssistantAssociation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteAssistantAssociation</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteAssistantAssociation
DeleteAssistantAssociation' :: Text -> Text -> DeleteAssistantAssociation

-- | The identifier of the assistant association. Can be either the ID or
--   the ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantAssociationId:DeleteAssistantAssociation'] :: DeleteAssistantAssociation -> Text

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.

--   fields omitted.

--   identifier of the assistant association. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
--

--   <a>deleteAssistantAssociation_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.

--   the ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.

--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.

-- | Creates a session. A session is a contextual container used for
--   generating recommendations. Amazon Connect creates a new Wisdom
--   session for each contact on which Wisdom is enabled.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateSession

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateSession</a> smart constructor.
data CreateSession
CreateSession' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> CreateSession

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateSession'] :: CreateSession -> Maybe Text

-- | The description.
[$sel:description:CreateSession'] :: CreateSession -> Maybe Text

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:CreateSession'] :: CreateSession -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantId:CreateSession'] :: CreateSession -> Text

-- | The name of the session.
[$sel:name:CreateSession'] :: CreateSession -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateSession</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateSession'</a>,
--   <a>createSession_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive identifier
--   that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateSession'</a>,
--   <a>createSession_description</a> - The description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateSession'</a>, <a>createSession_tags</a> - The tags
--   used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:CreateSession'</a>,
--   <a>createSession_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the Wisdom
--   assistant. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain the
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateSession'</a>, <a>createSession_name</a> - The name
--   of the session.
newCreateSession :: Text -> Text -> CreateSession

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
createSession_clientToken :: Lens' CreateSession (Maybe Text)

-- | The description.
createSession_description :: Lens' CreateSession (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
createSession_tags :: Lens' CreateSession (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
createSession_assistantId :: Lens' CreateSession Text

-- | The name of the session.
createSession_name :: Lens' CreateSession Text

-- | Creates a knowledge base.
--   
--   When using this API, you cannot reuse <a>Amazon AppIntegrations</a>
--   DataIntegrations with external knowledge bases such as Salesforce and
--   ServiceNow. If you do, you'll get an <tt>InvalidRequestException</tt>
--   error.
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;p&gt;For example, you're programmatically managing your external knowledge base, and you want to add or remove one of the fields that is being ingested from Salesforce. Do the following:&lt;/p&gt; &lt;ol&gt; &lt;li&gt; &lt;p&gt;Call &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wisdom/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteKnowledgeBase.html"&gt;DeleteKnowledgeBase&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt; &lt;p&gt;Call &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/appintegrations/latest/APIReference/API_DeleteDataIntegration.html"&gt;DeleteDataIntegration&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt; &lt;p&gt;Call &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/appintegrations/latest/APIReference/API_CreateDataIntegration.html"&gt;CreateDataIntegration&lt;/a&gt; to recreate the DataIntegration or a create different one.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li&gt; &lt;p&gt;Call CreateKnowledgeBase.&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/li&gt; &lt;/ol&gt; &lt;/note&gt;
--   </pre>
module Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateKnowledgeBase

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateKnowledgeBase</a> smart constructor.
data CreateKnowledgeBase
CreateKnowledgeBase' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe RenderingConfiguration -> Maybe SourceConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> CreateKnowledgeBase

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about how to render the content.
[$sel:renderingConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> Maybe RenderingConfiguration

-- | The source of the knowledge base content. Only set this argument for
--   EXTERNAL knowledge bases.
[$sel:sourceConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> Maybe SourceConfiguration

-- | The description.
[$sel:description:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key used for encryption.
[$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The type of knowledge base. Only CUSTOM knowledge bases allow you to
--   upload your own content. EXTERNAL knowledge bases support integrations
--   with third-party systems whose content is synchronized automatically.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseType:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> KnowledgeBaseType

-- | The name of the knowledge base.
[$sel:name:CreateKnowledgeBase'] :: CreateKnowledgeBase -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateKnowledgeBase</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,

--   identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:renderingConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_renderingConfiguration</a> - Information about
--   how to render the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_sourceConfiguration</a> - The source of the
--   knowledge base content. Only set this argument for EXTERNAL knowledge
--   bases.
