--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_description</a> - The description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The KMS
--   key used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>, <a>createKnowledgeBase_tags</a>
--   - The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseType:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_knowledgeBaseType</a> - The type of knowledge
--   base. Only CUSTOM knowledge bases allow you to upload your own
--   content. EXTERNAL knowledge bases support integrations with
--   third-party systems whose content is synchronized automatically.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>, <a>createKnowledgeBase_name</a>
--   - The name of the knowledge base.
newCreateKnowledgeBase :: KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> CreateKnowledgeBase

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
createKnowledgeBase_clientToken :: Lens' CreateKnowledgeBase (Maybe Text)

createKnowledgeBase_description :: Lens' CreateKnowledgeBase (Maybe Text)

createKnowledgeBase_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration :: Lens' CreateKnowledgeBase (Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration)

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
createKnowledgeBase_tags :: Lens' CreateKnowledgeBase (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

--   upload your own content. EXTERNAL knowledge bases support integrations
--   with third-party systems whose content is synchronized automatically.

createKnowledgeBase_name :: Lens' CreateKnowledgeBase Text

-- | Creates Wisdom content. Before to calling this API, use
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a> to upload an asset.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateContent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContent</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContent
CreateContent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateContent

-- | The URI you want to use for the article. If the knowledge base has a
--   templateUri, setting this argument overrides it for this piece of
--   content.
[$sel:overrideLinkOutUri:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | A key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
[$sel:metadata:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The title of the content. If not set, the title is equal to the name.
[$sel:title:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Text

-- | The name of the content. Each piece of content in a knowledge base
--   must have a unique name. You can retrieve a piece of content using
--   only its knowledge base and its name with the <a>SearchContent</a>
--   API.
[$sel:name:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Text

-- | A pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
[$sel:uploadId:CreateContent'] :: CreateContent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideLinkOutUri:CreateContent'</a>,
--   <a>createContent_overrideLinkOutUri</a> - The URI you want to use for
--   the article. If the knowledge base has a templateUri, setting this
--   argument overrides it for this piece of content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateContent'</a>,
--   <a>createContent_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive identifier
--   that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_metadata</a> - A
--   key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_title</a> - The
--   title of the content. If not set, the title is equal to the name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_tags</a> - The tags
--   used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:CreateContent'</a>,
--   <a>createContent_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_name</a> - The name
--   of the content. Each piece of content in a knowledge base must have a
--   unique name. You can retrieve a piece of content using only its
--   knowledge base and its name with the <a>SearchContent</a> API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_uploadId</a> - A
--   pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
newCreateContent :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateContent

-- | The URI you want to use for the article. If the knowledge base has a
--   templateUri, setting this argument overrides it for this piece of
--   content.
createContent_overrideLinkOutUri :: Lens' CreateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
createContent_clientToken :: Lens' CreateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | A key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
createContent_metadata :: Lens' CreateContent (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The title of the content. If not set, the title is equal to the name.
createContent_title :: Lens' CreateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
createContent_tags :: Lens' CreateContent (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
createContent_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' CreateContent Text

-- | The name of the content. Each piece of content in a knowledge base
--   must have a unique name. You can retrieve a piece of content using
--   only its knowledge base and its name with the <a>SearchContent</a>
--   API.
createContent_name :: Lens' CreateContent Text

-- | A pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
createContent_uploadId :: Lens' CreateContent Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContentResponse
CreateContentResponse' :: Maybe ContentData -> Int -> CreateContentResponse

-- | The content.
[$sel:content:CreateContentResponse'] :: CreateContentResponse -> Maybe ContentData

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:CreateContentResponse'] :: CreateContentResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContentResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:CreateContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContentResponse_content</a> - The content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContentResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateContentResponse :: Int -> CreateContentResponse

-- | The content.
createContentResponse_content :: Lens' CreateContentResponse (Maybe ContentData)

-- | The response's http status code.
createContentResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' CreateContentResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateContent.CreateContent
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateContent.CreateContent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateContent.CreateContent

instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateContent.CreateContent


-- | Creates an association between an Amazon Connect Wisdom assistant and
--   another resource. Currently, the only supported association is with a
--   knowledge base. An assistant can have only a single association.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateAssistantAssociation

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssistantAssociation</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAssistantAssociation
CreateAssistantAssociation' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> AssistantAssociationInputData -> AssociationType -> CreateAssistantAssociation

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateAssistantAssociation'] :: CreateAssistantAssociation -> Maybe Text

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:CreateAssistantAssociation'] :: CreateAssistantAssociation -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:assistantId:CreateAssistantAssociation'] :: CreateAssistantAssociation -> Text

-- | The identifier of the associated resource.
[$sel:association:CreateAssistantAssociation'] :: CreateAssistantAssociation -> AssistantAssociationInputData

-- | The type of association.
[$sel:associationType:CreateAssistantAssociation'] :: CreateAssistantAssociation -> AssociationType

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssistantAssociation</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency
--   of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAssistantAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>createAssistantAssociation_tags</a> - The tags used to organize,
--   track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:CreateAssistantAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>createAssistantAssociation_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:association:CreateAssistantAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>createAssistantAssociation_association</a> - The identifier of the
--   associated resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associationType:CreateAssistantAssociation'</a>,
--   <a>createAssistantAssociation_associationType</a> - The type of
--   association.
newCreateAssistantAssociation :: Text -> AssistantAssociationInputData -> AssociationType -> CreateAssistantAssociation

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
createAssistantAssociation_clientToken :: Lens' CreateAssistantAssociation (Maybe Text)

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
createAssistantAssociation_tags :: Lens' CreateAssistantAssociation (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The identifier of the Wisdom assistant. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
createAssistantAssociation_assistantId :: Lens' CreateAssistantAssociation Text

-- | The identifier of the associated resource.
createAssistantAssociation_association :: Lens' CreateAssistantAssociation AssistantAssociationInputData

-- | The type of association.
createAssistantAssociation_associationType :: Lens' CreateAssistantAssociation AssociationType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssistantAssociationResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateAssistantAssociationResponse
CreateAssistantAssociationResponse' :: Maybe AssistantAssociationData -> Int -> CreateAssistantAssociationResponse

[$sel:assistantAssociation:CreateAssistantAssociationResponse'] :: CreateAssistantAssociationResponse -> Maybe AssistantAssociationData

--   <a>createAssistantAssociationResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's

-- | Creates an Amazon Connect Wisdom assistant.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.CreateAssistant

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssistant</a> smart constructor.
data CreateAssistant
CreateAssistant' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> AssistantType -> CreateAssistant

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
[$sel:clientToken:CreateAssistant'] :: CreateAssistant -> Maybe Text

-- | The description of the assistant.
[$sel:description:CreateAssistant'] :: CreateAssistant -> Maybe Text

-- | The KMS key used for encryption.
[$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:CreateAssistant'] :: CreateAssistant -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration

-- | The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
[$sel:tags:CreateAssistant'] :: CreateAssistant -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The name of the assistant.
[$sel:name:CreateAssistant'] :: CreateAssistant -> Text

-- | The type of assistant.
[$sel:type':CreateAssistant'] :: CreateAssistant -> AssistantType

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateAssistant</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateAssistant'</a>,

--   identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateAssistant'</a>,
--   <a>createAssistant_description</a> - The description of the assistant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:CreateAssistant'</a>,
--   <a>createAssistant_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The KMS key
--   used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateAssistant'</a>, <a>createAssistant_tags</a> - The
--   tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateAssistant'</a>, <a>createAssistant_name</a> - The
--   name of the assistant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':CreateAssistant'</a>, <a>createAssistant_type</a> - The
--   type of assistant.
newCreateAssistant :: Text -> AssistantType -> CreateAssistant

-- | A unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the
--   idempotency of the request.
createAssistant_clientToken :: Lens' CreateAssistant (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the assistant.
createAssistant_description :: Lens' CreateAssistant (Maybe Text)

createAssistant_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration :: Lens' CreateAssistant (Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration)

createAssistant_tags :: Lens' CreateAssistant (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of the assistant.
createAssistant_name :: Lens' CreateAssistant Text

-- | The type of assistant.
createAssistant_type :: Lens' CreateAssistant AssistantType

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateAssistantResponse</a> smart constructor.

-- | Removes the specified tags from the specified resource.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.UntagResource

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagResource</a> smart constructor.
data UntagResource

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

[$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'] :: UntagResource -> NonEmpty Text

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   the resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagResource'</a>, <a>untagResource_tagKeys</a> - The
--   tag keys.
newUntagResource :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> UntagResource

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

-- | Updates information about the content.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContent</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContent
UpdateContent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateContent

-- | The URI for the article. If the knowledge base has a templateUri,
--   setting this argument overrides it for this piece of content. To
--   remove an existing <tt>overrideLinkOurUri</tt>, exclude this argument
--   and set <tt>removeOverrideLinkOutUri</tt> to true.
[$sel:overrideLinkOutUri:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | Unset the existing <tt>overrideLinkOutUri</tt> if it exists.
[$sel:removeOverrideLinkOutUri:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Maybe Bool

-- | A key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
[$sel:metadata:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The title of the content.
[$sel:title:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | The <tt>revisionId</tt> of the content resource to update, taken from
--   an earlier call to <tt>GetContent</tt>, <tt>GetContentSummary</tt>,
--   <tt>SearchContent</tt>, or <tt>ListContents</tt>. If included, this
--   argument acts as an optimistic lock to ensure content was not modified
--   since it was last read. If it has been modified, this API throws a
--   <tt>PreconditionFailedException</tt>.
[$sel:revisionId:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | A pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
[$sel:uploadId:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Maybe Text

-- | The identifier of the content. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:contentId:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:UpdateContent'] :: UpdateContent -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideLinkOutUri:UpdateContent'</a>,
--   <a>updateContent_overrideLinkOutUri</a> - The URI for the article. If
--   the knowledge base has a templateUri, setting this argument overrides
--   it for this piece of content. To remove an existing
--   <tt>overrideLinkOurUri</tt>, exclude this argument and set
--   <tt>removeOverrideLinkOutUri</tt> to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:removeOverrideLinkOutUri:UpdateContent'</a>,
--   <a>updateContent_removeOverrideLinkOutUri</a> - Unset the existing
--   <tt>overrideLinkOutUri</tt> if it exists.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_metadata</a> - A
--   key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_title</a> - The
--   title of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revisionId:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_revisionId</a>
--   - The <tt>revisionId</tt> of the content resource to update, taken
--   from an earlier call to <tt>GetContent</tt>,
--   <tt>GetContentSummary</tt>, <tt>SearchContent</tt>, or
--   <tt>ListContents</tt>. If included, this argument acts as an
--   optimistic lock to ensure content was not modified since it was last
--   read. If it has been modified, this API throws a
--   <tt>PreconditionFailedException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_uploadId</a> - A
--   pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentId:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_contentId</a> -
--   The identifier of the content. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:UpdateContent'</a>,
--   <a>updateContent_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN
newUpdateContent :: Text -> Text -> UpdateContent

-- | The URI for the article. If the knowledge base has a templateUri,
--   setting this argument overrides it for this piece of content. To
--   remove an existing <tt>overrideLinkOurUri</tt>, exclude this argument
--   and set <tt>removeOverrideLinkOutUri</tt> to true.
updateContent_overrideLinkOutUri :: Lens' UpdateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | Unset the existing <tt>overrideLinkOutUri</tt> if it exists.
updateContent_removeOverrideLinkOutUri :: Lens' UpdateContent (Maybe Bool)

-- | A key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
updateContent_metadata :: Lens' UpdateContent (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The title of the content.
updateContent_title :: Lens' UpdateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The <tt>revisionId</tt> of the content resource to update, taken from
--   an earlier call to <tt>GetContent</tt>, <tt>GetContentSummary</tt>,
--   <tt>SearchContent</tt>, or <tt>ListContents</tt>. If included, this
--   argument acts as an optimistic lock to ensure content was not modified
--   since it was last read. If it has been modified, this API throws a
--   <tt>PreconditionFailedException</tt>.
updateContent_revisionId :: Lens' UpdateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | A pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
updateContent_uploadId :: Lens' UpdateContent (Maybe Text)

-- | The identifier of the content. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
updateContent_contentId :: Lens' UpdateContent Text

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN
updateContent_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' UpdateContent Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContentResponse
UpdateContentResponse' :: Maybe ContentData -> Int -> UpdateContentResponse

-- | The content.
[$sel:content:UpdateContentResponse'] :: UpdateContentResponse -> Maybe ContentData

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateContentResponse'] :: UpdateContentResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContentResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:UpdateContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateContentResponse_content</a> - The content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateContentResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newUpdateContentResponse :: Int -> UpdateContentResponse

-- | The content.
updateContentResponse_content :: Lens' UpdateContentResponse (Maybe ContentData)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateContentResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateContentResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance GHC.Read.Read Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContentResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContentResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContentResponse
instance Amazonka.Types.AWSRequest Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContentResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance Amazonka.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance Amazonka.Data.Path.ToPath Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent
instance Amazonka.Data.Query.ToQuery Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateContent.UpdateContent


-- | Updates the template URI of a knowledge base. This is only supported
--   for knowledge bases of type EXTERNAL. Include a single variable in
--   <tt>${variable}</tt> format; this interpolated by Wisdom using
--   ingested content. For example, if you ingest a Salesforce article, it
--   has an <tt>Id</tt> value, and you can set the template URI to
--   <tt>https://myInstanceName.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Knowledge__kav/*${Id}*/view</tt>.
module Amazonka.Wisdom.UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri
UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri' :: Text -> Text -> UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
[$sel:knowledgeBaseId:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri'] :: UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri -> Text

-- | The template URI to update.
[$sel:templateUri:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri'] :: UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri'</a>,
--   <a>updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the
--   identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN.
--   URLs cannot contain the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateUri:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri'</a>,
--   <a>updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri_templateUri</a> - The template URI
--   to update.
newUpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri :: Text -> Text -> UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri

-- | The the identifier of the knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the
--   ARN. URLs cannot contain the ARN.
updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri Text

-- | The template URI to update.
updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri_templateUri :: Lens' UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUri Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse
UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse' :: Maybe KnowledgeBaseData -> Int -> UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse

-- | The knowledge base to update.
[$sel:knowledgeBase:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse'] :: UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse -> Maybe KnowledgeBaseData

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse'] :: UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBase:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse_knowledgeBase</a> - The
--   knowledge base to update.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse'</a>,
--   <a>updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse_httpStatus</a> - The
--   response's http status code.
newUpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse :: Int -> UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse

-- | The knowledge base to update.
updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse_knowledgeBase :: Lens' UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse (Maybe KnowledgeBaseData)

-- | The response's http status code.
updateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' UpdateKnowledgeBaseTemplateUriResponse Int

--   <tt>WaitTimeSeconds</tt>. If no messages are available and the wait

-- | A key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.

--   an earlier call to <tt>GetContent</tt>, <tt>GetContentSummary</tt>,
--   <tt>SearchContent</tt>, or <tt>ListContents</tt>. If included, this
--   argument acts as an optimistic lock to ensure content was not modified
--   since it was last read. If it has been modified, this API throws a
--   <tt>PreconditionFailedException</tt>.

-- | The fields from the source that are made available to your agents in
--   Wisdom.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For <a>Salesforce</a>, you must include at least <tt>Id</tt>,
--   <tt>ArticleNumber</tt>, <tt>VersionNumber</tt>, <tt>Title</tt>,
--   <tt>PublishStatus</tt>, and <tt>IsDeleted</tt>.</li>
--   <li>For <a>ServiceNow</a>, you must include at least <tt>number</tt>,
--   <tt>short_description</tt>, <tt>sys_mod_count</tt>,
--   <tt>workflow_state</tt>, and <tt>active</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Make sure to include additional field(s); these are indexed and used
--   to source recommendations.
appIntegrationsConfiguration_objectFields :: Lens' AppIntegrationsConfiguration (NonEmpty Text)

assistantAssociationInputData_knowledgeBaseId :: Lens' AssistantAssociationInputData (Maybe Text)

-- | A URI template containing exactly one variable in <tt>${variableName}
--   </tt>format. This can only be set for <tt>EXTERNAL</tt> knowledge
--   bases. For Salesforce and ServiceNow, the variable must be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Salesforce: <tt>Id</tt>, <tt>ArticleNumber</tt>,
--   <tt>VersionNumber</tt>, <tt>Title</tt>, <tt>PublishStatus</tt>, or
--   <tt>IsDeleted</tt></li>
--   <li>ServiceNow: <tt>number</tt>, <tt>short_description</tt>,
--   <tt>sys_mod_count</tt>, <tt>workflow_state</tt>, or
--   <tt>active</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;p&gt;The variable is replaced with the actual value for a piece of content when calling &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wisdom/latest/APIReference/API_GetContent.html"&gt;GetContent&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;/p&gt;
--   </pre>

module Amazonka.Wisdom.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2020-10-19</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   All Amazon Connect Wisdom functionality is accessible using the API.
--   For example, you can create an assistant and a knowledge base.
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;p&gt;Some more advanced features are only accessible using the Wisdom API. For example, you can manually manage content by uploading custom files and control their lifecycle. &lt;/p&gt;
--   </pre>
module Amazonka.Wisdom

-- | API version <tt>2020-10-19</tt> of the Amazon Connect Wisdom Service
--   SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS
--   service.
_ValidationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The provided <tt>revisionId</tt> does not match, indicating the
--   content has been modified since it was last read.
_PreconditionFailedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Amazon Connect Wisdom throws this exception if you have too many tags
--   in your tag set.
_TooManyTagsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request could not be processed because of conflict in the current
--   state of the resource. For example, if you're using a <tt>Create</tt>
--   API (such as <tt>CreateAssistant</tt>) that accepts name, a
--   conflicting resource (usually with the same name) is being created or
--   mutated.
_ConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | You've exceeded your service quota. To perform the requested action,
--   remove some of the relevant resources, or use service quotas to
--   request a service quota increase.
_ServiceQuotaExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified resource does not exist.
_ResourceNotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:ListAssistants'</a>, <a>listAssistants_nextToken</a>
--   - The token for the next set of results. Use the value returned in the
--   previous response in the next request to retrieve the next set of
--   results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:ListAssistants'</a>,
--   <a>listAssistants_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of results to
--   return per page.
newListAssistants :: ListAssistants

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateContent</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateContent
UpdateContent' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> UpdateContent

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideLinkOutUri:UpdateContent'</a>,
--   <a>updateContent_overrideLinkOutUri</a> - The URI for the article. If
--   the knowledge base has a templateUri, setting this argument overrides
--   it for this piece of content. To remove an existing
--   <tt>overrideLinkOurUri</tt>, exclude this argument and set
--   <tt>removeOverrideLinkOutUri</tt> to true.
--   
--   <a>$sel:removeOverrideLinkOutUri:UpdateContent'</a>,
--   <a>updateContent_removeOverrideLinkOutUri</a> - Unset the existing
--   <tt>overrideLinkOutUri</tt> if it exists.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_metadata</a> - A
--   key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_title</a> - The
--   title of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revisionId:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_revisionId</a>
--   - The <tt>revisionId</tt> of the content resource to update, taken
--   from an earlier call to <tt>GetContent</tt>,
--   <tt>GetContentSummary</tt>, <tt>SearchContent</tt>, or
--   <tt>ListContents</tt>. If included, this argument acts as an
--   optimistic lock to ensure content was not modified since it was last
--   read. If it has been modified, this API throws a
--   <tt>PreconditionFailedException</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_uploadId</a> - A
--   pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentId:UpdateContent'</a>, <a>updateContent_contentId</a> -
--   The identifier of the content. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs
--   cannot contain the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:UpdateContent'</a>,
--   <a>updateContent_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN
newUpdateContent :: Text -> Text -> UpdateContent

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContent</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:overrideLinkOutUri:CreateContent'</a>,
--   <a>createContent_overrideLinkOutUri</a> - The URI you want to use for
--   the article. If the knowledge base has a templateUri, setting this
--   argument overrides it for this piece of content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateContent'</a>,
--   <a>createContent_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive identifier
--   that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_metadata</a> - A
--   key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_title</a> - The
--   title of the content. If not set, the title is equal to the name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_tags</a> - The tags
--   used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:CreateContent'</a>,
--   <a>createContent_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base. Can be either the ID or the ARN. URLs cannot contain
--   the ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_name</a> - The name
--   of the content. Each piece of content in a knowledge base must have a
--   unique name. You can retrieve a piece of content using only its
--   knowledge base and its name with the <a>SearchContent</a> API.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadId:CreateContent'</a>, <a>createContent_uploadId</a> - A
--   pointer to the uploaded asset. This value is returned by
--   <a>StartContentUpload</a>.
newCreateContent :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateContent

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateContentResponse</a> smart constructor.
data CreateContentResponse
CreateContentResponse' :: Maybe ContentData -> Int -> CreateContentResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateContentResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:content:CreateContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContentResponse_content</a> - The content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:CreateContentResponse'</a>,
--   <a>createContentResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newCreateContentResponse :: Int -> CreateContentResponse

data CreateKnowledgeBase
CreateKnowledgeBase' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe RenderingConfiguration -> Maybe SourceConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> CreateKnowledgeBase

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateKnowledgeBase</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientToken:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_clientToken</a> - A unique, case-sensitive
--   identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:renderingConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_renderingConfiguration</a> - Information about
--   how to render the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_sourceConfiguration</a> - The source of the
--   knowledge base content. Only set this argument for EXTERNAL knowledge
--   bases.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_description</a> - The description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The KMS
--   key used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>, <a>createKnowledgeBase_tags</a>
--   - The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this
--   resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseType:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>,
--   <a>createKnowledgeBase_knowledgeBaseType</a> - The type of knowledge
--   base. Only CUSTOM knowledge bases allow you to upload your own
--   content. EXTERNAL knowledge bases support integrations with
--   third-party systems whose content is synchronized automatically.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CreateKnowledgeBase'</a>, <a>createKnowledgeBase_name</a>
--   - The name of the knowledge base.
newCreateKnowledgeBase :: KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> CreateKnowledgeBase

newtype AssistantStatus
AssistantStatus' :: Text -> AssistantStatus
[fromAssistantStatus] :: AssistantStatus -> Text
pattern AssistantStatus_ACTIVE :: AssistantStatus
pattern AssistantStatus_CREATE_FAILED :: AssistantStatus
pattern AssistantStatus_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: AssistantStatus
pattern AssistantStatus_DELETED :: AssistantStatus
pattern AssistantStatus_DELETE_FAILED :: AssistantStatus
pattern AssistantStatus_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: AssistantStatus
newtype AssistantType
AssistantType' :: Text -> AssistantType
[fromAssistantType] :: AssistantType -> Text
pattern AssistantType_AGENT :: AssistantType
newtype AssociationType
AssociationType' :: Text -> AssociationType
[fromAssociationType] :: AssociationType -> Text
pattern AssociationType_KNOWLEDGE_BASE :: AssociationType
newtype ContentStatus
ContentStatus' :: Text -> ContentStatus
[fromContentStatus] :: ContentStatus -> Text
pattern ContentStatus_ACTIVE :: ContentStatus
pattern ContentStatus_CREATE_FAILED :: ContentStatus
pattern ContentStatus_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: ContentStatus
pattern ContentStatus_DELETED :: ContentStatus
pattern ContentStatus_DELETE_FAILED :: ContentStatus
pattern ContentStatus_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: ContentStatus
pattern ContentStatus_UPDATE_FAILED :: ContentStatus
newtype FilterField
FilterField' :: Text -> FilterField
[fromFilterField] :: FilterField -> Text
pattern FilterField_NAME :: FilterField
newtype FilterOperator
FilterOperator' :: Text -> FilterOperator
[fromFilterOperator] :: FilterOperator -> Text
pattern FilterOperator_EQUALS :: FilterOperator
newtype KnowledgeBaseStatus
KnowledgeBaseStatus' :: Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus
[fromKnowledgeBaseStatus] :: KnowledgeBaseStatus -> Text
pattern KnowledgeBaseStatus_ACTIVE :: KnowledgeBaseStatus
pattern KnowledgeBaseStatus_CREATE_FAILED :: KnowledgeBaseStatus
pattern KnowledgeBaseStatus_CREATE_IN_PROGRESS :: KnowledgeBaseStatus
pattern KnowledgeBaseStatus_DELETED :: KnowledgeBaseStatus
pattern KnowledgeBaseStatus_DELETE_FAILED :: KnowledgeBaseStatus
pattern KnowledgeBaseStatus_DELETE_IN_PROGRESS :: KnowledgeBaseStatus
newtype KnowledgeBaseType
KnowledgeBaseType' :: Text -> KnowledgeBaseType
[fromKnowledgeBaseType] :: KnowledgeBaseType -> Text
pattern KnowledgeBaseType_CUSTOM :: KnowledgeBaseType
pattern KnowledgeBaseType_EXTERNAL :: KnowledgeBaseType
newtype RelevanceLevel
RelevanceLevel' :: Text -> RelevanceLevel
[fromRelevanceLevel] :: RelevanceLevel -> Text
pattern RelevanceLevel_HIGH :: RelevanceLevel
pattern RelevanceLevel_LOW :: RelevanceLevel
pattern RelevanceLevel_MEDIUM :: RelevanceLevel

-- | Configuration information for Amazon AppIntegrations to automatically
--   ingest content.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAppIntegrationsConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data AppIntegrationsConfiguration
AppIntegrationsConfiguration' :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> AppIntegrationsConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>AppIntegrationsConfiguration</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:appIntegrationArn:AppIntegrationsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>appIntegrationsConfiguration_appIntegrationArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the AppIntegrations DataIntegration to use for
--   ingesting content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectFields:AppIntegrationsConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>appIntegrationsConfiguration_objectFields</a> - The fields from the
--   source that are made available to your agents in Wisdom.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>For <a>Salesforce</a>, you must include at least <tt>Id</tt>,
--   <tt>ArticleNumber</tt>, <tt>VersionNumber</tt>, <tt>Title</tt>,
--   <tt>PublishStatus</tt>, and <tt>IsDeleted</tt>.</li>
--   <li>For <a>ServiceNow</a>, you must include at least <tt>number</tt>,
--   <tt>short_description</tt>, <tt>sys_mod_count</tt>,
--   <tt>workflow_state</tt>, and <tt>active</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Make sure to include additional field(s); these are indexed and used
--   to source recommendations.
newAppIntegrationsConfiguration :: Text -> NonEmpty Text -> AppIntegrationsConfiguration

-- | Information about the assistant association.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssistantAssociationData</a> smart constructor.
data AssistantAssociationData
AssistantAssociationData' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> AssistantAssociationOutputData -> AssociationType -> AssistantAssociationData

-- | Create a value of <a>AssistantAssociationData</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AssistantAssociationData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationData_tags</a> - The tags used to organize,
--   track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantArn:AssistantAssociationData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationData_assistantArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the Wisdom assistant
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantAssociationArn:AssistantAssociationData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationData_assistantAssociationArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the assistant association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantAssociationId:AssistantAssociationData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationData_assistantAssociationId</a> - The
--   identifier of the assistant association.
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:AssistantAssociationData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationData_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the
--   Wisdom assistant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associationData:AssistantAssociationData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationData_associationData</a> - A union type that
--   currently has a single argument, the knowledge base ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:associationType:AssistantAssociationData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationData_associationType</a> - The type of
--   association.
newAssistantAssociationData :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> AssistantAssociationOutputData -> AssociationType -> AssistantAssociationData

-- | The data that is input into Wisdom as a result of the assistant
--   association.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssistantAssociationInputData</a> smart constructor.
data AssistantAssociationInputData
AssistantAssociationInputData' :: Maybe Text -> AssistantAssociationInputData

-- | Create a value of <a>AssistantAssociationInputData</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:AssistantAssociationInputData'</a>,
--   <a>assistantAssociationInputData_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the
--   identifier of the knowledge base.
newAssistantAssociationInputData :: AssistantAssociationInputData

-- | The data that is output as a result of the assistant association.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssistantAssociationOutputData</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AssistantAssociationOutputData

-- | Create a value of <a>AssistantAssociationOutputData</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--

--   <a>assistantAssociationOutputData_knowledgeBaseAssociation</a> - The
--   knowledge base where output data is sent.
newAssistantAssociationOutputData :: AssistantAssociationOutputData

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAssistantData</a> smart constructor.

--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   <a>assistantData_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The KMS key
--   used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:AssistantData'</a>, <a>assistantData_tags</a> - The tags
--   used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.

--   status of the assistant.
--

--   of assistant.
newAssistantData :: Text -> Text -> Text -> AssistantStatus -> AssistantType -> AssistantData

newAssistantSummary :: Text -> Text -> Text -> AssistantStatus -> AssistantType -> AssistantSummary

-- | Information about the content.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContentData</a> smart constructor.
data ContentData
ContentData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> HashMap Text Text -> Text -> Text -> ContentStatus -> Text -> Sensitive Text -> POSIX -> ContentData

-- | Create a value of <a>ContentData</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:linkOutUri:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_linkOutUri</a> -
--   The URI of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_tags</a> - The tags used
--   to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentArn:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_contentArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentId:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_contentId</a> - The
--   identifier of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_contentType</a> -
--   The media type of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:ContentData'</a>,
--   <a>contentData_knowledgeBaseArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:ContentData'</a>,
--   <a>contentData_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_metadata</a> - A
--   key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_name</a> - The name of
--   the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revisionId:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_revisionId</a> -
--   The identifier of the content revision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_status</a> - The
--   status of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_title</a> - The title
--   of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_url</a> - The URL of the
--   content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:urlExpiry:ContentData'</a>, <a>contentData_urlExpiry</a> - The
--   expiration time of the URL as an epoch timestamp.
newContentData :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ContentStatus -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> ContentData

-- | Reference information about the content.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContentReference</a> smart constructor.
data ContentReference
ContentReference' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ContentReference

-- | Create a value of <a>ContentReference</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentArn:ContentReference'</a>,
--   <a>contentReference_contentArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentId:ContentReference'</a>,
--   <a>contentReference_contentId</a> - The identifier of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:ContentReference'</a>,
--   <a>contentReference_knowledgeBaseArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:ContentReference'</a>,
--   <a>contentReference_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base.
newContentReference :: ContentReference

-- | Summary information about the content.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContentSummary</a> smart constructor.
data ContentSummary
ContentSummary' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> HashMap Text Text -> Text -> Text -> ContentStatus -> Text -> ContentSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>ContentSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ContentSummary'</a>, <a>contentSummary_tags</a> - The
--   tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentArn:ContentSummary'</a>,
--   <a>contentSummary_contentArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentId:ContentSummary'</a>, <a>contentSummary_contentId</a>
--   - The identifier of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentType:ContentSummary'</a>,
--   <a>contentSummary_contentType</a> - The media type of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:ContentSummary'</a>,
--   <a>contentSummary_knowledgeBaseArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:ContentSummary'</a>,
--   <a>contentSummary_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metadata:ContentSummary'</a>, <a>contentSummary_metadata</a> -
--   A key/value map to store attributes without affecting tagging or
--   recommendations. For example, when synchronizing data between an
--   external system and Wisdom, you can store an external version
--   identifier as metadata to utilize for determining drift.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContentSummary'</a>, <a>contentSummary_name</a> - The
--   name of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revisionId:ContentSummary'</a>,
--   <a>contentSummary_revisionId</a> - The identifier of the revision of
--   the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ContentSummary'</a>, <a>contentSummary_status</a> - The
--   status of the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:ContentSummary'</a>, <a>contentSummary_title</a> - The
--   title of the content.
newContentSummary :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ContentStatus -> Text -> ContentSummary

-- | The document.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocument</a> smart constructor.
data Document
Document' :: Maybe DocumentText -> Maybe DocumentText -> ContentReference -> Document

-- | Create a value of <a>Document</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:excerpt:Document'</a>, <a>document_excerpt</a> - The excerpt
--   from the document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:title:Document'</a>, <a>document_title</a> - The title of the
--   document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contentReference:Document'</a>,
--   <a>document_contentReference</a> - A reference to the content
--   resource.
newDocument :: ContentReference -> Document

-- | The text of the document.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDocumentText</a> smart constructor.
data DocumentText
DocumentText' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe [Highlight] -> DocumentText

-- | Create a value of <a>DocumentText</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:text:DocumentText'</a>, <a>documentText_text</a> - Text in the
--   document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:highlights:DocumentText'</a>, <a>documentText_highlights</a> -
--   Highlights in the document text.
newDocumentText :: DocumentText

-- | A search filter.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newFilter</a> smart constructor.
data Filter
Filter' :: FilterField -> FilterOperator -> Text -> Filter

-- | Create a value of <a>Filter</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:field:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_field</a> - The field on which to
--   filter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:operator:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_operator</a> - The operator to
--   use for comparing the field’s value with the provided value.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Filter'</a>, <a>filter_value</a> - The desired field
--   value on which to filter.
newFilter :: FilterField -> FilterOperator -> Text -> Filter

-- | Offset specification to describe highlighting of document excerpts for
--   rendering search results and recommendations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHighlight</a> smart constructor.
data Highlight
Highlight' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Highlight

-- | Create a value of <a>Highlight</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:endOffsetExclusive:Highlight'</a>,
--   <a>highlight_endOffsetExclusive</a> - The offset for the end of the
--   highlight.
--   
--   <a>$sel:beginOffsetInclusive:Highlight'</a>,
--   <a>highlight_beginOffsetInclusive</a> - The offset for the start of
--   the highlight.
newHighlight :: Highlight

newKnowledgeBaseAssociationData :: KnowledgeBaseAssociationData

-- | Information about the knowledge base.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKnowledgeBaseData</a> smart constructor.
data KnowledgeBaseData
KnowledgeBaseData' :: Maybe RenderingConfiguration -> Maybe SourceConfiguration -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseData

-- | Create a value of <a>KnowledgeBaseData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:renderingConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_renderingConfiguration</a> - Information about
--   how to render the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_sourceConfiguration</a> - Source configuration
--   information about the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastContentModificationTime:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_lastContentModificationTime</a> - An epoch
--   timestamp indicating the most recent content modification inside the
--   knowledge base. If no content exists in a knowledge base, this value
--   is unset.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_description</a> - The description.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The KMS
--   key used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>, <a>knowledgeBaseData_tags</a> -
--   The tags used to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of the
--   knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseType:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseData_knowledgeBaseType</a> - The type of knowledge
--   base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>, <a>knowledgeBaseData_name</a> -
--   The name of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:KnowledgeBaseData'</a>, <a>knowledgeBaseData_status</a>
--   - The status of the knowledge base.
newKnowledgeBaseData :: Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseData

-- | Summary information about the knowledge base.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKnowledgeBaseSummary</a> smart constructor.
data KnowledgeBaseSummary
KnowledgeBaseSummary' :: Maybe RenderingConfiguration -> Maybe SourceConfiguration -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>KnowledgeBaseSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:renderingConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_renderingConfiguration</a> - Information about
--   how to render the content.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_sourceConfiguration</a> - [KEVIN]
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_description</a> - The description of the
--   knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverSideEncryptionConfiguration:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_serverSideEncryptionConfiguration</a> - The
--   KMS key used for encryption.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_tags</a> - The tags used to organize, track,
--   or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseArn:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseArn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseId:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseId</a> - The the identifier of
--   the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:knowledgeBaseType:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_knowledgeBaseType</a> - The type of knowledge
--   base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_name</a> - The name of the knowledge base.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:KnowledgeBaseSummary'</a>,
--   <a>knowledgeBaseSummary_status</a> - The status of the knowledge base
--   summary.
newKnowledgeBaseSummary :: Text -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseType -> Text -> KnowledgeBaseStatus -> KnowledgeBaseSummary

-- | An error occurred when creating a recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newNotifyRecommendationsReceivedError</a> smart
--   constructor.
data NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError
NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError

-- | Create a value of <a>NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationId:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceivedError_recommendationId</a> - The
--   identifier of the recommendation that is in error.
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError'</a>,
--   <a>notifyRecommendationsReceivedError_message</a> - A recommendation
--   is causing an error.
newNotifyRecommendationsReceivedError :: NotifyRecommendationsReceivedError

-- | Information about the recommendation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRecommendationData</a> smart constructor.
data RecommendationData
RecommendationData' :: Maybe RelevanceLevel -> Maybe Double -> Document -> Text -> RecommendationData

-- | Create a value of <a>RecommendationData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relevanceLevel:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_relevanceLevel</a> - The relevance level of the
--   recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:relevanceScore:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_relevanceScore</a> - The relevance score of the
--   recommendation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:document:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_document</a> - The recommended document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:recommendationId:RecommendationData'</a>,
--   <a>recommendationData_recommendationId</a> - The identifier of the
--   recommendation.
newRecommendationData :: Document -> Text -> RecommendationData

-- | Information about how to render the content.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRenderingConfiguration</a> smart constructor.
data RenderingConfiguration
RenderingConfiguration' :: Maybe Text -> RenderingConfiguration

-- | Create a value of <a>RenderingConfiguration</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:templateUri:RenderingConfiguration'</a>,
--   <a>renderingConfiguration_templateUri</a> - A URI template containing
--   exactly one variable in <tt>${variableName} </tt>format. This can only
--   be set for <tt>EXTERNAL</tt> knowledge bases. For Salesforce and
--   ServiceNow, the variable must be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Salesforce: <tt>Id</tt>, <tt>ArticleNumber</tt>,
--   <tt>VersionNumber</tt>, <tt>Title</tt>, <tt>PublishStatus</tt>, or
--   <tt>IsDeleted</tt></li>
--   <li>ServiceNow: <tt>number</tt>, <tt>short_description</tt>,
--   <tt>sys_mod_count</tt>, <tt>workflow_state</tt>, or
--   <tt>active</tt></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;p&gt;The variable is replaced with the actual value for a piece of content when calling &lt;a href="https://docs.aws.amazon.com/wisdom/latest/APIReference/API_GetContent.html"&gt;GetContent&lt;/a&gt;. &lt;/p&gt;
--   </pre>
newRenderingConfiguration :: RenderingConfiguration

-- | Information about the result.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResultData</a> smart constructor.
data ResultData
ResultData' :: Maybe Double -> Document -> Text -> ResultData

--

--   fields.
--

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>$sel:relevanceScore:ResultData'</a>,
--   <a>resultData_relevanceScore</a> - The relevance score of the results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:document:ResultData'</a>, <a>resultData_document</a> - The
--   document.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resultId:ResultData'</a>, <a>resultData_resultId</a> - The
--   identifier of the result data.
newResultData :: Document -> Text -> ResultData

newServerSideEncryptionConfiguration :: ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration

-- | Information about the session.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionData</a> smart constructor.
data SessionData
SessionData' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SessionData

-- | Create a value of <a>SessionData</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_description</a> -
--   The description of the session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_tags</a> - The tags used
--   to organize, track, or control access for this resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_name</a> - The name of
--   the session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionArn:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_sessionArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionId:SessionData'</a>, <a>sessionData_sessionId</a> - The
--   identifier of the session.
newSessionData :: Text -> Text -> Text -> SessionData

-- | Summary information about the session.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSessionSummary</a> smart constructor.
data SessionSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>SessionSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantArn:SessionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionSummary_assistantArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the Wisdom assistant
--   
--   <a>$sel:assistantId:SessionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionSummary_assistantId</a> - The identifier of the Wisdom
--   assistant.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionArn:SessionSummary'</a>,
--   <a>sessionSummary_sessionArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of
--   the session.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sessionId:SessionSummary'</a>, <a>sessionSummary_sessionId</a>
--   - The identifier of the session.
newSessionSummary :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> SessionSummary

--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
